instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No power
threads.message:
Have another board . Found and isolated a short to <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>. Once <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> is removed, the short is gone. Short is on 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_PMU_VDDMAIN</SIGNAL>

My question is can i replace this chip with one from a seller from china or does this have firmware or files specific to the board model, which would mean i need to swap from another board of the same pn?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No power
threads.message:
PMIC has lot of GPIO pins, look at page 65.
Not sure if all them are defined on its firmware, or have fixed pin designation.

If you decide to try new chip, let us know the result.
